tips: Follow your plan from Section 4 - don't change structure midway
Use topic sentences to start each body paragraph
Include linking words (However, Furthermore, For instance)
Avoid contractions (don't → do not, can't → cannot)
Leave 5 minutes at the end to check for errors

sections.title: Check Your Essay
sections.description: Use this checklist to review your work

items.label: Introduction clearly paraphrases the question (not copied)
tips: Use synonyms: children → young people, smartphones → mobile devices, advantages → benefits

items.label: Body paragraph 1 discusses advantages with clear topic sentence
tips: Topic sentence = first sentence stating main advantage

items.label: Body paragraph 2 discusses disadvantages equally
tips: Use transition: However, On the negative side, Despite these benefits

items.label: Conclusion summarizes both advantages and disadvantages
tips: Don't introduce new ideas in conclusion

items.label: Both advantages and disadvantages are discussed equally
tips: Count sentences - both sides should have similar length

items.label: Multiple points provided for each side
tips: Aim for at least 2-3 points per side

items.label: Specific examples are provided
tips: Real examples like studies or specific apps are strongest

items.label: All parts of the question are fully addressed
No repeated words - synonyms used throughout
Topic vocabulary from Section 2 is used correctly
Complex sentences are used (not all simple sentences)
tips: Use: who, which, that, although, while, because

items.label: Verb tenses are consistent and correct

sections.title: Band 8 Model Answer
sections.description: Compare your essay with this high-band example

essay.fullEssay:
The prevalence of smartphone ownership among young people has increased dramatically in recent years, with devices now common even among elementary school children. While these mobile devices offer certain benefits related to safety and education, they also present significant risks to physical and psychological development.

On the positive side, smartphones enhance child safety through communication capabilities and location tracking features. Parents can monitor their children's whereabouts using GPS applications, providing peace of mind and security. Furthermore, children can contact parents or emergency services immediately if they encounter dangerous situations, something that would be impossible without mobile connectivity. Additionally, smartphones provide access to valuable educational resources, including learning apps, online libraries, and instructional videos. These tools enable children to explore subjects independently and develop digital literacy skills increasingly essential in modern society.

However, the disadvantages of early smartphone access are substantial and well-documented. Excessive screen time significantly harms physical development, reducing opportunities for outdoor play and exercise while contributing to rising childhood obesity rates. Moreover, prolonged device usage disrupts sleep patterns, which are crucial for growing children. The psychological impacts are equally concerning, with research linking heavy smartphone use to attention deficit problems, anxiety, and reduced social skills. Children also face exposure to age-inappropriate content and cyberbullying, issues that parents struggle to monitor effectively despite supervision efforts. Furthermore, smartphones create constant distractions from homework and face-to-face interactions, potentially impeding academic performance and family relationships.

In conclusion, while smartphones offer genuine advantages in terms of safety and learning access, their negative effects on child health and development are significant. Parents must implement strict usage limits, appropriate content filters, and active supervision to mitigate these risks effectively.

strengths: Balanced discussion of both advantages and disadvantages
Clear organization with strong topic sentences
Wide range of vocabulary (prevalence, whereabouts, well-documented)
Complex sentence structures with varied grammar
